article.title: Logos Supports Surveillance Systems in Afghanistan
article.text: Logos Technologies Inc., Fairfax, Virginia, is being awarded an $18,615,621 cost-plus-fixed-fee contract to provide operations, maintenance, and logistics services in support of Kestrel Wide Area Surveillance systems and sensors deployed on Persistent Ground Surveillance Systems and Persistent Threat Detection Systems aerostats in support of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization Resolute Support mission for the Army. Work will be performed in Fairfax, Virginia (55 percent); Afghanistan (30 percent); Yuma, Arizona (5 percent); Raleigh, North Carolina (5 percent); and Pt. Mugu, California (5 percent), and is expected to be completed in December 2015. Fiscal 2015 operations and maintenance (Army) funds in the amount of $3,240,741 are being obligated at time of award, all of which will expire at the end of the current fiscal year. This contract was not competitively procured pursuant to 10 U.S.C. 2304(c)(1). The Naval Air Warfare Center Aircraft Division, Lakehurst, New Jersey, is the contracting activity (N68335-15-C-0144).
